result.execSummary:
The defendant Lawrence D. Brock Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Lawrence D. Brock Sr. is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Lawrence D. Brock Sr. was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $50 per month payment plan to start on or before January 15, 2015

Sentenced to 45 days in Marquette County Jail with huber. 
May transfer to Marathon County.
Report on or before February 13, 2015 by 7:00 p.m. clean & sober.

12/22/14 - COURT ORDERED 8 DAYS TOTAL JAIL CREDIT

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lawrence D. Brock Sr.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
from Mr. Brock wanting to pay $50 instead of the $200 to get him out of jail.  
Per Judge, he needs to pay $200 and then continue with payment plan per month.
Subject in Custody per Sheriff's Dept.
JAIL CREDIT STIPULATION - 8 DAYS TOTAL CREDIT

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF31, 14CT24 & 14TR612 tracking together:
Atty Hendee moves to amend the charge in 14CF31 to Misd. Possession; remove the repeater.  
  Atty Gumz states plea agreement to 14CT24 and the amended charge in 14CF31.  Court questios the defendant.  Defendant agrees and enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of 14CT24 and the amended charge in 14CF31.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  14TR612 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the recommendations.
Atty Gumz responds.
Defendant makes a statement to the court and asks that the bail be returned.

BY THE COURT:  14CT24:  Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Surcharge = $200.00

14CF31:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 45 days in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report on or before February 13, 2015 by 7:00pm, clean & sober.
May transfer to Marathon County
Credit = 4 days
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Surcharge = $200.00
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in January
Court grants the request to return the cash bond to the party that posted it.
Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

14TR612 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 17, 2014 at 02:45 pm.

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CT24, 14TR612 & 14CF31 tracking together:
Atty Gumz states that there is an agreement; however, his client did call back today and he is in Madison and cannot be here.   Atty Gumz asks for a reset on the matter to allow time for his client to be here.
Atty Hendee requests a warrant but stayed until the date of the next hearing.

BY THE COURT:  Warrant authorized; stayed until December 17th.
Reset Plea/Sentencing date.
bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 4, 2014 at 11:00 am.
***13CF31, 14CT24 & 14TR612 ARE TRACKING TOGETHER***
Jury trial on December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lawrence D. Brock in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF31, 14CT24 & 14TR612:
Atty Gumz states that the matters are not resolved and enters a Not Guilty plea if one has not been entered yet.  Atty Gumz asks for a trial date.  Atty Hendee states that there has been no arraignment yet.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.    Defendant stands mute.  Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant in 14CF31.
Set for Trial.
bond continued in all matters.

Atty Gumz states that there may be a motion to modify the bond and requests that the defendant be allowed to appear by telephone for that hearing.
BY THE COURT:  Court will allow the defendant to appear by phone.  Jury trial scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Plea hearing on July 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Lawrence D Brock in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CT24 & 14TR612 are tracking with.
Atty Hendee states that after talking with Atty Gumz it is to his understanding that the defendant will be waiving the Preliminary Hearing.  Atty Gumz agrees and states that in talking with his client an offer was made and the defendant will waive the Prelim and asks for a Plea date.    Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Hendee files the information with the court.
  Defendant received a copy of the information & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz requests a Plea date.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Plea.
14CT24 & 14TR612 should be set for Return dates.
bond continued.
  Plea hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:15 pm.
signed on 4/14/14
Cash Bond amended to $100 cash and $150 Signature Bond  ($150 cash from original cash bond to be returned to poster)
Preliminary hearing on June 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.
**Bond amended from $250 cash to $100 cash and $150 signature.  The $150.00 cash to be returned to the poster.

Defendant Lawrence D Brock in court with attorney Mark J Gumz.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF31 & 14CT24
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz waives time limits for preliminary hearing.  Atty Gumz states motion to amend bond.  Atty Hendee does not take a position on the bond amendment.  BY THE COURT:  Court will amend to $100 cash with $150 signature.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 10:30 am.

for Modification of Bail
filed by Atty Gumz
Initial appearance on April 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
*no conditions

Defendant Lawrence D Brock in court, in custody.  Chad A Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Atty Hendee requests a $250 cash bond.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he is not working right now and requests a signature bond because he has child support to pay.
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he last worked in November.  

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $250 cash bond.  Initial appearance scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:00 pm.
